summary: User seeks best practices for integrating Sentry error logging with Temporal PHP SDK, asking whether a global error handler exists to catch errors from workflows and activities, or if integration with RoadRunner is possible.
userImpact: Users lack a standardized way to integrate Sentry for centralized error logging across activities and workflows, requiring manual try-catch and logging in each activity.
rootCause: The SDK does not provide a built-in global error handler or PSR-3 logger injection mechanism for activities, requiring users to implement error handling manually.
proposedFix: Implement container refactoring with activity call interception capability to catch exceptions globally, or make SDK properties protected for extension.
workaround: Intercept activity calls using a custom router (e.g., InvokeActivityRouter) or extend WorkerFactory, though this requires accessing private fields and is considered hacky.
keyQuote: The container refactor planned later this year, with some internal changes and optimizations, including the ability to intercept activity call (for exception catching or state resets).
